page.title: 05BUILDINGS 1
page.content: The houses by Whitewater school are semi-detached and they have pebble-dash on part of the walls.They have two storeys and they have medium pitched roofs. The next building is the village hall. It is not very old, some of the windows haven't got any glass in, it is a medium pitched roof. The hall has two storeys and the brick pattern used is called{"Flemish Bond." The hall is very big and has beams. The bungalow, called "Weavers",has a low pitched roof, and is meant for three people. The brick pattern is called{"Stretcher Bond."} Wogsbarn Cottage has two storeys,the roof is medium pitched, and the brick pattern is{"Flemish Bond."}The windows open outwards and the tiles are uneven. { }
